summary:
"David Copperfield," written by Charles Dickens, is a coming-of-age story told by David himself. It's like a real-life adventure, based on Dickens' own life, where David grows up from a baby to an adult. The book was first published in parts in 1849-1850.

Dickens didn't plan it all out; he just started writing and let the story unfold. It begins with a sad look at being a kid in old England, then shows David's rise in society. Dickens makes fun of how things were back then, like how women were treated and how kids had to work in factories. It's a favorite among his books and shows how he became a better writer.
title: David Copperfield
